pullRequest.body:
This PR introduces a Dependabot configuration specifically for managing dependencies in GitHub Actions workflows.

It automates the process of checking for updates to GitHub Actions dependencies.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [956eea66a5](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/18013/commits/956eea66a52f79b03f44987b3eb58f9c74e4f356)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by grunweg.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11442658481/job/31833495566)
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11442658481/job/31833496023)

Ah, it's not the end of the world, but since depandabot isn't aware of our `bors.in.yml` system, we won't be able to use its PRs as is for those updates. cf. #18017 .

I'll go through and do a manual update including all the updates now.

The manual update PR is at #18026
(These PRs also broke the queueboard, as the PR author doesn't have a standard github handle --- but this was easy to fix. I was also surprised by this.)

This is my first time reviewing such a file --- cross-checking [github's documentation](https://docs.github.com/en/code-security/dependabot/dependabot-version-updates/configuring-dependabot-version-updates) about [this](https://docs.github.com/en/code-security/dependabot/dependabot-version-updates/configuration-options-for-the-dependabot.yml-file#scheduleinterval), this looks sensible. Thanks for automating this!

~~Can you add some brief explanation what this does to the PR description? Thanks!~~ Never mind, you already did that.
maintainer merge

This is my first time reviewing such a file --- cross-checking [github's documentation](https://docs.github.com/en/code-security/dependabot/dependabot-version-updates/configuring-dependabot-version-updates) about [this](https://docs.github.com/en/code-security/dependabot/dependabot-version-updates/configuration-options-for-the-dependabot.yml-file#scheduleinterval), this looks sensible. Thanks for automating this!

~~Can you add some brief explanation what this does to the PR description? Thanks!~~ Never mind, you already did that.
maintainer merge
IIRC, other repositories like the queueboard have "monthly" here. Do you have a particular reason for the different frequency?
Nope, I can change that immediately.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: add dependabot
